metadata.title: CVE-2023-26769 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Buffer Overflow vulnerability found in Liblouis Lou_Trace v.3.24.0 allows aremote attacker to cause a denial of service via the resolveSubtablefunction at compileTranslationTabel.c.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-26769` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

liblouis-bin - 3.5.0-1ubuntu0.5
liblouis-data - 3.5.0-1ubuntu0.5
liblouis14 - 3.5.0-1ubuntu0.5
python-louis - 3.5.0-1ubuntu0.5
python3-louis - 3.5.0-1ubuntu0.5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: liblouis package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.5.0-1ubuntu0.5').
